metadata.title: CVE-2018-25032 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
zlib before 1.2.12 allows memory corruption when deflating (i.e., whencompressing) if the input has many distant matches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
lib64z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
libx32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
zlib1g - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

rsync - 3.1.2-2.1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zlib package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.1').
rsync package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-2.1ubuntu1.4').
klibc package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
